intro: Harpullia camptoneura, commonly known as the broad-leaved harpullia, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. It is often found in lowland rainforests and thrives in humid, warm climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a shade tree.
